title: ClickTight Convertibles: Forward-Facing LATCH Installation
description:
How to install the Britax Marathon ClickTight, Boulevard ClickTight, and Advocate ClickTight convertible car seats in forward-facing mode using the LATCH System. 
**Refer to your user guide for complete installation instructions.

asset.author: Britax Child Safety, Inc
asset.hookText:
How to install the Britax Marathon ClickTight, Boulevard ClickTight, and Advocate ClickTight convertible car seats in forward-facing mode using the LATCH System. 
**Refer to your user guide for complete installation instructions.
For more information about Britax ClickTight convertible car seats, visit http://www.britaxusa.com/clicktight-convertibles

transcripts: Remove the tether from the compartment and retainer tabs. And place it over the child seat back. Open the latch compartment at the back of the base. And then remove the latch connectors. Now place the seat forward facing in the vehicle. Ensure that the base of the child seat is flat and that no more than three inches of the base hangs over the edge of the vehicle seat. Also check that there is no interference with the vehicle head restraint. If there is the vehicle head restrain should be raised, removed ,restored or a different seating position may need to be used. Open the click tight by pressing the dimple on the click tight dial and rotating the dial clockwise until it releases and lift to open. Pull the lower connector strap toward the child's left side and extend the full length. Slide the lower connector strapped into the board facing belt slots. Firmly pressed the lower connectors over their adjacent lower anchors. Verify that the connectors are secure and that the strap is not twisted. Then pull the link to the lower connector strap to remove slack. Close the click tight. Until a click was heard. The click tight logo must be in the horizontal position. Ensure the ball in the recline indicator is within the allowable green section for the size of the child. Check that the child seat cannot be moved front to back or side to side more than one inch at the belt pack. Locate the designated vehicle tether anchor. Attach the tether. And remove slack.
